definition: chemical weapon/abbr. for 化學武器|化学武器[hua4 xue2 wu3 qi4]
to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]

sentences.english: The findings uphold Iraq's prewar insistence that it did not possess chemical or biological weapons.
sentences.chinese: 调查结果支持了伊拉克战前声称没有生化武器的声明。

sentences.english: China isn't hiding or containing their biological weapons program very well.
sentences.chinese: 中国没有将他们的生化武器计划藏得很好啊。

sentences.english: He has also equated cyberthreats with nuclear and biological weapons.
sentences.chinese: 他还把网络威胁与核武器和生化武器相提并论。

sentences.english: The superpowers are stockpiling bacteriological and biological weapons.
sentences.chinese: 超级大国在储备细菌武器和生化武器。

sentences.english: Firstly, positive efforts should be made to facilitate the process of chemical weapons destruction.
sentences.chinese: 积极努力，推动化武销毁进程。

sentences.english: Initial tests for chemical weapons were negative, he added.
sentences.chinese: 他补充说，化武的初步测试为阴性。

sentences.english: China hopes that States Parties will pay more attention to the issue of the JACWs.
sentences.chinese: 中方希望各国对日遗化武问题给予更多关注。

sentences.english: Thirdly, the future development of the OPCW represents an important topic of this Organization.
sentences.chinese: 第三，禁化武组织未来发展是本组织的一项重要议题。

sentences.english: Firstly, the OPCW should make continuous and relentless efforts to press CW destruction forward.
sentences.chinese: 第一，禁化武组织应继续坚持不懈推进化武销毁工作。

sentences.english: Firstly, the OPCW should make continuous and relentless efforts to press CW destruction forward.
sentences.chinese: 第一，禁化武组织应继续坚持不懈推进化武销毁工作。

pinyin: da4 gui1 mo2 sha1 shang1 xing4 wu3 qi4

definition: Muslim countries/caliphate/Islamic State group (aka IS or ISIL or ISIS)
